alert.note: Alert for Chilton (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 8:25PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Chilton County through 915 PM CDT... At 824 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chilton County Motor Sports Park, or 10 miles southwest of Jemison, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Calera, Clanton, Jemison, Thorsby, Maplesville, Mitchell Lake, Gap Of The Mountain, Lay Lake Dam, Chilton County Motor Sports Park, Higgins Ferry Park, Lay Lake, Minooka Park, Lomax, Waxahatchee Creek, I 65 Rest Area, Mitchell Dam, Isabella and Cooper. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
